noun.description: An alliance for combined action, especially a temporary alliance of political parties forming a government or of states.
examples: a coalition of conservatives and disaffected Democrats
the party was only able to govern in coalition with three or even four other parties

origin: Early 17th century (in the sense fusion): from medieval Latin coalitio(n-), from the verb coalescere (see coalesce). Usage in politics dates from the late 18th century.
